fields.Org Description: The Harvard Humanitarian Initiative (HHI) is a university-wide academic and research center in humanitarian crisis and leadership. Our mission is to create new knowledge and advance evidence-based leadership in disasters and humanitarian crisis. Our work focuses on two main areas: the Humanitarian Academy at Harvard and Research & Translation.

Founded in 1386, Ruperto Carola is the oldest university in today's Germany and one of Europe’s leading research institutions. It defines itself as an internationally networked research university dedicated to research-oriented teaching. With over 160 fields of study, it offers the broad spectrum of subjects representative of a comprehensive university as well as abundant opportunities to acquire a singular and internationally competitive qualification profile.

The Barcelona School of Economics (BSE) was founded in 2006 by Andreu Mas-Colell as an institution for scientific cooperation between four academic units: two university departments and two research centers with a long tradition of collaboration and a history of leadership in the field of Economics.
fields.Org Mission: BSE aims to promote the creation and transmission of frontier knowledge in Economics and related disciplines, by consolidating Barcelona as a world-class center of research, academic education, and professional training with the ultimate goals of informing policy and promoting economic and social wellbeing.

fields.Org Description: UNICEF’s Data Team is the global go-to for data on children. It leads the collection, validation, analysis, use and communication of the most statistically sound, internationally comparable data on the situation of children and women around the world.

fields.Org Full Name: WFP: United Nations World Food Programme
fields.Org Description: We work to enhance nutrition in women and children, support smallholder farmers in improving productivity and reducing losses, help countries and communities prepare for and cope with climate-related shocks, and boost human capital through school feeding programmes.

The Netherlands Red Cross‘ data and digital unit 510 aims to help every National Red Cross and Red Crescent Society in need anywhere. It is named after the total surface area of the earth (510 million square kilometres). 510 started in 2016 with a core team of 3 and never stopped growing. Currently, 510 has more than 100 team members, of whom 70+ are professional volunteers and academic students.
fields.Org Mission: It’s purpose is to improve speed, quality and cost-effectiveness of humanitarian aid by creating products and services using data and digital.

fields.Org Full Name: OHCHR: United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights
fields.Org Description: The High Commissioner for Human Rights is the principal human rights official of the United Nations. The United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights is accountable to the Secretary-General and is responsible for all the activities of OHCHR, as well as for its administration.

fields.Org Full Name: CRED: University of Louvain Centre for Research on the Epidemiology of Disasters
fields.Org Description: The Centre for Research on the Epidemiology of Disasters (CRED  has been active for over 50 years and is recognized as a reference institution in the field of disasters and emergency situations: CRED promotes research, training, and technical expertise in humanitarian emergencies, particularly in public health and epidemiology. Its main research topic is natural disasters. By providing a wealth of data related to health, the centre aims to improve disasters preparedness and response. CRED is managing the EM-DAT database, quantifying the occurrence, human and economic impacts associated with natural and technological disasters.

UNFPA, the United Nations Population Fund, works globally to ensure universal access to sexual and reproductive health, prevent and respond to gender-based violence, collect and use population data, and promote gender equality and the empowerment of women and youth across the humanitarian/development continuum.
The Feminist Humanitarian Network (FHN) is a global collective of feminist leaders working together to transform the humanitarian system into one that is guided by feminist principles.
fields.Org Mission: To contribute to transforming the current humanitarian system into an intersectional feminist ecosystem, free of the structural inequalities that drive crises, including racism, patriarchy, colonialism and neoliberalism.

fields.Org Description: UN Women is the United Nations entity dedicated to gender equality and the empowerment of women. A global champion for women and girls, UN Women was established to accelerate progress on meeting their needs worldwide.

The US Geological Survey maintains extensive data services and conducts numerous data-related projects across various fields, including mapping mineral resources, analyzing global supply chains, and conducting environmental monitoring and research. Projects often involve collaborations with other governmental agencies, universities, and private companies. For example, USGS offers technical assistance internationally, with expertise in areas like seismic monitoring and water resource assessment. Their Community for Data Integration (CDI) supports data-driven research by funding projects that enhance data analysis tools, such as the Terrestrial Remote Sensing Data Ingestion with PyHAT, which facilitates the use of multiple terrestrial datasets for machine learning analysis.

fields.Org Full Name: UNODA: United Nations Office for Disarmament Affairs
fields.Org Description: UNODA provides substantive and organizational support for norm-setting in the area of disarmament through the work of the General Assembly and its First Committee, the Disarmament Commission, the Conference on Disarmament and other bodies. It fosters disarmament measures through dialogue, transparency and confidence-building on military matters, and encourages regional disarmament efforts; these include the United Nations Register of Conventional Arms and regional forums.

Global Pulse is an initiative of the United Nations focused on harnessing big data, artificial intelligence, and emerging technologies to support sustainable development and humanitarian action. The organization collaborates with UN agencies, governments, and partners worldwide to analyze real-time data and generate insights that inform decision-making. By leveraging advanced analytics, Global Pulse aims to improve crisis response, monitor global trends, and promote data-driven policies.

The University of Edinburgh is a public research university based in Edinburgh, Scotland. Founded by the town council under the authority of a royal charter from King James VI in 1582 and officially opened in 1583, it is one of Scotland's four ancient universities and the sixth-oldest university in continuous operation in the English-speaking world.
Humanitarian Outcomes is an independent research organisation providing evidence and policy advice to inform better humanitarian action.

The University of Stirling builds its academic identity around research-informed social science, environmental studies, and behavioral science, integrating interdisciplinary approaches with a campus designed to support empirical fieldwork, sports science development, and public policy analysis.

UNDP works in about 170 countries and territories, helping to eradicate poverty, reduce inequalities and exclusion, and build resilience so countries can sustain progress. As the UN’s development agency, UNDP plays a critical role in helping countries achieve the Sustainable Development Goals.

The Centre for Humanitarian Data is focused on increasing the use and impact of data in the humanitarian sector. It is managed by the United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA). As part of OCHA’s Information Management Branch, the Centre’s role is to enable the organization to deliver on its ambition to be more data-driven and analytical, and to ensure a responsible approach to technology and data management.

fields.Org Full Name: FSNWG: Food Security and Nutrition Working Group
fields.Org Description: The Food Security and Nutrition Working Group (FSNWG) is a regional platform, currently co-chaired by ICPAC and FAO. It’s goal is two-fold: to provide an up-to-date food security and nutrition situation analysis (early warning) and to offer a forum to build consensus on critical issues facing policy and interventions. The FNSWG has served regional governments, donors, and non-governmental agencies since the early 2000’s. Current membership includes approximately 80 organisations (IGAD, UN agencies, NGOs, donors, and research institutions) who contribute to the operation of the working group, and its nutrition, markets, food security information, livestock and pastoralist sub-groups.

fields.Org Full Name: UNOSAT: The United Nations Satellite Centre
fields.Org Description: The United Nations Satellite Centre (UNOSAT), part of UNITAR, delivers satellite analysis, training, and capacity development to UN entities and Member States. We leverage geospatial technologies to support humanitarian response, sustainable development, and resilience building worldwide.

Pacific Disaster Center (PDC) is a leading scientific innovator of global risk reduction science and technology. As a University of Hawai’i applied science and research center, our work intersects with a variety of government, community, academic, and scientific organizations at home and around the world to build resilience to natural and man-made hazards, assess risk, and enhance the capacity to quickly and accurately anticipate and prepare for new and emerging threats.

Uppsala University is the oldest Nordic university, founded in 1477. Today we are a comprehensive research university with a clear mission: to pursue top-quality research and education and to interact constructively with society, thus contributing to a better world.

fields.Org Full Name: SIPRI: Stockholm International Peace Research Institute
fields.Org Description: SIPRI is an independent international institute dedicated to research into conflict, armaments, arms control and disarmament. Established in 1966, SIPRI provides data, analysis and recommendations, based on open sources, to policymakers, researchers, media and the interested public. Based in Stockholm, SIPRI is regularly ranked among the most respected think tanks worldwide.

fields.Org Full Name: UNMAS: United Nations Mine Action Service
fields.Org Description: UNMAS (United Nations Mine Action Service) utilizes data to inform and manage mine action programs globally, coordinating with other UN entities and partners. They maintain an Interactive Dashboard of the UN Mine Action Strategy, which presents data on program outcomes, outputs, targeted populations, and funding. UNMAS also collaborates on data-related projects, including a machine learning initiative to detect development indicators in cleared areas of Afghanistan using satellite imagery, which informs their efforts to eliminate the threat of mines and explosives.

Flowminder also co-founded, in partnership with UNFPA, WorldPop at the University of Southampton, and CIESIN at Columbia University the GRID3 programme. GRID3 was an international partnership programme funded by the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation and the United Kingdom’s Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office to map a path to sustainable development for everyone with geospatial data solutions.

fields.Org Full Name: OCHA: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs
fields.Org Description: Support humanitarian organizations to respond effectively to the needs of people caught in crises, to understand and analyse their needs, and to mobilize international assistance. We provide tools and services to help humanitarian organizations ensure that no one affected by a crisis is left behind.
fields.Org Mission: OCHA coordinates the global emergency response to save lives and protect people in humanitarian crises. We advocate for effective and principled humanitarian action by all, for all.
fields.Org IATI Name: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

fields.Org Description: The Peace Research Institute Oslo (PRIO) conducts research on the conditions for peaceful relations between states, groups and people.

fields.Org Full Name: FEWS NET: Famine Early Warning Systems Network
fields.Org Description: The Famine Early Warning Systems Network (FEWS NET) is a leading provider of early warning and analysis on acute food insecurity around the world.

Since 2013, Data-Pop Alliance has worked to apply cutting edge data science to solve the world’s most pressing problems. As the 2030 deadline for the UN sustainable development goals approaches, we believe novel approaches are needed to enhance the efficacy of the global development sector and reach those most in need.

INSO provides a coherent, sector-wide response to this need, delivering action-oriented solutions that go beyond saving individual lives to enable humanitarian operations in acutely challenging environments.
fields.Org Mission:
We serve as the safety coordination and advisory body to the NGO community and provide daily support to more than 1,000 registered organisations working in high-risk contexts.

INSO's mission is to support humanitarian safety and access in high-risk countries.

fields.Org Description: GEM is a non-profit, scientific, public-private partnership that fosters global collaboration, developing transparent earthquake risk assessment resources for worldwide risk management.
Fields Data focusses on having data ready before the occurrence of a disaster, thereby saving lives through preparedness and efficient response.
MapSwipe is a humanitarian crowdsourcing app where volunteers swipe through satellite images to help map vulnerable areas that aid organizations rely on.

fields.Org Full Name: Josef Korbel School, University of Denver
fields.Org Description: The Josef Korbel School of Global and Public Affairs at the University of Denver is a professional school of international affairs offering undergraduate, graduate, and doctoral degrees. It is named in honor of the founding dean, Josef Korbel, father of former U.S. Secretary of State Madeleine Albright

Founded in 1956, the Danish Refugee Council (DRC) is Denmark’s largest international NGO, with a specific expertise in forced displacement. DRC is present in close to 40 countries. DRC advocates for the rights of and solutions for displacement-affected communities, and provides assistance during all stages of displacement: In acute crisis, in exile, when settling and integrating in a new place, or upon return. DRC supports displaced persons in becoming self-reliant and included into hosting societies. DRC works with civil society and responsible authorities to promote protection of rights and inclusion.

REACH is a leading humanitarian initiative providing granular data, timely information and in-depth analysis from contexts of crisis, disaster and displacement. The work of REACH directly feeds into aid response and decision-making by providing accessible and precise information on the humanitarian situation of crisis-affected populations.

fields.Org Full Name: UNDPPA: United Nations Department of Political and Peacebuilding Affairs
fields.Org Description: The Department of Political and Peacebuilding Affairs (DPPA) plays a central role in United Nations efforts to prevent and resolve conflict around the world. DPPA supports the Secretary-General’s peace initiatives, oversees mediation, political transition and peacebuilding processes, and assists UN Member States as they carry out elections.

The U.S. Department of State is a federal government agency responsible for leading the nation’s foreign policy and international relations. It represents the United States to other countries, negotiates treaties and agreements, and promotes American interests abroad. The Department also provides support to U.S. citizens traveling or living overseas, issues passports and visas, and works to advance global peace, security, and prosperity. As the principal diplomatic arm of the federal government, the Department of State plays a vital role in shaping and implementing the country’s foreign policy objectives.
fields.Org IATI Name: United States Agency for International Development (USAID)

fields.Org Full Name: HOT: Humanitarian Open Street Map Team
fields.Org Description: HOT is an international team dedicated to humanitarian action and community development through open mapping. We work together to provide map data which revolutionises disaster management, reduces risks, and contributes to achievement of the Sustainable Development Goals.
fields.Org Mission: Reaching those in need through maps

fields.Org Full Name: ACLED: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data
fields.Org Description: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data (ACLED) is a disaggregated data collection, analysis, and crisis mapping initiative. ACLED collects information on the dates, actors, locations, fatalities, and types of all reported political violence and protest events around the world. The ACLED team conducts analysis to describe and explore conflict trends.
fields.Org Mission: Our mission is to provide accurate and accessible data and analysis to better inform decisions that reduce violent conflict.

fields.Org Description: IMPACT’s PANDA initiative aims to improve the effectiveness, efficiency and efficacy of humanitarian and development interventions. PANDA supports the entire humanitarian programme cycle, including programme design, assessments, baselines, monitoring and evaluation.

WorldPop is an interdisciplinary applied research group focusing primarily on supporting improvement of the spatial demographic evidence base and the use of these data for health and development applications, including addressing the Sustainable Development Goals. Its mission is to enable decision makers to harness the power of spatial demographic data through high quality applied research, to achieve a vision of a world where everyone, everywhere is counted in decision making.

fields.Org Full Name: DHS: The Demographic and Health Survey
fields.Org Description: The DHS Program (Demographic and Health Surveys) is a primary source of data on health and population trends in developing countries, having provided technical assistance to over 300 surveys in more than 90 countries since 1984. They collect and disseminate nationally representative data on critical areas including fertility, family planning, maternal and child health, gender, HIV/AIDS, malaria, and nutrition. Funded by USAID and other donors, and implemented by ICF International, The DHS Program plays a vital role in advancing global understanding of health and population issues.

Data Friendly Space (DFS) provides trustworthy digital tools and actionable data for social impact organisations to fulfil their mission. We believe that the international community holds not just the knowledge, but also the responsibility to utilise emerging technologies and data to better prepare for and respond to humanitarian needs, support the achievement of Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), and accelerate climate action.

fields.Org Full Name: UNESCO: United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization
fields.Org Description: The United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) is the agency of the United Nations contributing to building peace through international cooperation in education, the sciences and culture.
fields.Org IATI Name: United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO)

fields.Org Description: We are a non-profit organisation collaborating with partners around the world to prepare for and respond to humanitarian emergencies. We strive to ensure global, regional, national and local disaster management and humanitarian agencies have access to the maps, visualised data, information and analysis that they need to make key decisions, at the right times, to save lives and reduce suffering.

The International Crisis Group is an independent organisation working to prevent wars and shape policies that will build a more peaceful world.
Crisis Group sounds the alarm to prevent deadly conflict. We build support for the good governance and inclusive politics that enable societies to flourish. We engage directly with a range of conflict actors to seek and share information, and to encourage intelligent action for peace.

Coventry University focuses on applied teaching and industry-linked learning, emphasizing practical skills, professional accreditation, and career-oriented programs in fields such as engineering, business, and health, while expanding its profile through international partnerships and vocational innovation.

Queen’s University Belfast positions itself as a research-intensive institution supported by strong engineering, medicine, and social science faculties, contributing to technological innovation, public health research, and regional economic development while maintaining structured links with government and industry.

Arab Barometer is a nonpartisan research network that provides insight into the social, political, and economic attitudes and values of ordinary citizens across the Arab world. We have been conducting high quality and reliable public opinion surveys in the Middle East and North Africa since 2006. We are the longest-standing and the largest repository of publicly available data on the views of men and women in the MENA region. Our findings give a voice to the needs and concerns of Arab publics.

fields.Org Full Name: IFRC: International Federation of the Red Cross and Red Crescent
fields.Org Description: The International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies (IFRC) is the world's largest humanitarian organization, with 190 member National Societies. As part of the International Red Cross and Red Crescent Movement, our work is guided by seven fundamental principles; humanity, impartiality, neutrality, independence, voluntary service, unity and universality.
fields.Org IATI Name: International Federation of the Red Cross and Red Crescent (IFRC)

fields.Org Description: The Joint Research Centre (JRC) is the European Commission's science and knowledge service which employs scientists to carry out research in order to provide independent scientific advice and support to European Union (EU) policy.

fields.Org Full Name: UNCCD: United Nations Convention to Combat Desertification
fields.Org Description: The UNCCD is the global voice for land. We promote practices that avoid, reduce and reverse land degradation and are the driving force behind Sustainable Development Goal 15 and Land Degradation Neutrality.

The World Meteorological Organization fosters the international exchange and standardization of meteorological and hydrological data, crucial for weather forecasting, climate monitoring, and water resource management. Their World Climate Data and Monitoring Programme (WCDMP) coordinates climate data and assessment, while initiatives like data rescue projects, including the MEditerranean climate DAta REscue (MEDARE) project and the International Environmental Data Rescue Organization (IEDRO), work to digitize historical data for research and analysis. The WMO also implements the WMO Hydrological Observing System (WHOS) through the WMO HydroHub to facilitate data sharing and capacity building in hydrology.

fields.Org Full Name: UNDRR: United Nations Office for Disaster Risk Reduction
fields.Org Description: The United Nations Office for Disaster Risk Reduction (UNDRR) has a big ambition: to help decision makers across the globe better understand and act on risk.  At UNDRR, we envision a world where disasters no longer threaten the well-being of people and the future of the planet. Sustainable development and the 2030 Agenda cannot be achieved without working towards that goal of building resilience.

fields.Org Full Name: UNHCR: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees
fields.Org Description: UNHCR, the UN Refugee Agency, is a global organization dedicated to saving lives, protecting rights and building a better future for people forced to flee their homes because of conflict and persecution. We lead international action to protect refugees, forcibly displaced communities and stateless people.
fields.Org IATI Name: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR)

fields.Org Description: 3iS’s mission is to empower and enhance the understanding of information through innovative technology, successfully driving strategic change and transforming decision-making. We use data and cutting-edge technology to generate knowledge that equips leaders and change agents to better achieve their objectives in the humanitarian, development, and academic sectors.

Afrobarometer, a non-profit company limited by guarantee with headquarters in Ghana, is a pan-African, non-partisan survey research network that conducts public attitude surveys on democracy, governance, the economy, and society. Afrobarometer is the world’s leading source of high-quality data on what Africans are thinking.

The Afrobarometer network encompasses more than 30 national partners responsible for data collection, analysis, and in-country dissemination of findings. Regional coordination is provided by the Ghana Center for Democratic Development (CDD-Ghana), the Institute for Justice and Reconciliation (IJR) in South Africa, and the Institute for Development Studies (IDS) at the University of Nairobi in Kenya. Michigan State University (MSU) and the University of Cape Town (UCT) provide technical support to the network.
fields.Org Mission:
To make citizen voice a key pillar of African policy and decision making
A world in which Africa’s development is anchored in the realities and aspirations of its people

fields.Org Full Name: ICPAC: IGAD Climate Prediction and Applications Centre
fields.Org Description: The IGAD Climate Prediction and Applications Centre (ICPAC) plays a vital role in the humanitarian context of the Greater Horn of Africa (GHA) by providing critical climate services to 11 countries. ICPAC's mission is to foster climate services and knowledge to enhance community resilience in a region highly susceptible to climate change and extreme weather events.

fields.Org Full Name: FAO: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations
fields.Org Description: The Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) is a specialized agency of the United Nations dedicated to leading global efforts to eliminate hunger. Established to improve nutrition, increase agricultural productivity, and raise the standard of living in rural populations, the FAO works with governments and partners worldwide. Its mission includes developing policies, sharing knowledge, and providing technical assistance to ensure food security and sustainable agricultural development for all. Through its initiatives, the FAO aims to create a world where everyone has regular access to enough high-quality food to lead active, healthy lives.
fields.Org Mission: Our goal is to achieve food security for all and make sure that people have regular access to enough high-quality food to lead active, healthy lives. With 195 members - 194 countries and the European Union, FAO works in over 130 countries worldwide.
fields.Org IATI Name: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

fields.Org Description: University of California, Irvine was founded with a mission to catalyze the community and enhance lives through rigorous academics, cutting-edge research, and dedicated public service. Today, we draw on the unyielding spirit of our pioneering faculty, staff and students who arrived on campus with a dream to inspire change and generate new ideas. We believe that true progress is made when different perspectives come together to advance our understanding of the world around us. And we enlighten our communities and point the way to a better future. At UCI, we shine brighter.

The University of St Andrews emphasizes rigorous teaching and research across the humanities, sciences, and social sciences, supporting scholarship through small-group instruction, historical academic traditions, and internationally oriented research in disciplines such as international relations, philosophy, and marine science.
The World Bank is an international financial institution that provides loans and grants to the governments of low- and middle-income countries for the purposes of economic development.
fields.Org IATI Name: The World Bank or World Bank Trust Funds

fields.Org Description: World Peace Foundation is a center at Tufts University's The Fletcher School, that produces innovative research for nonviolent futures. The WPF redefines peace through research, advocacy and engagement that creates pathways for non-violent futures. Since 1910, when WPF was created, ideas about peace and how to attain it have evolved. Our contribution lies in research and outreach informed by principles of justice.

The Internal Displacement Monitoring Centre (IDMC) is the world's leading source of data and analysis on internal displacement. Since our establishment in 1998 as part of the Norwegian Refugee Council (NRC), we have offered a rigorous, independent and trusted service to the international community. Our work informs policy and operational decisions that improve the lives of the millions of people living in internal displacement, or at risk of becoming displaced in the future.
fields.Org Mission:
The world's leading source of data and analysis on internal displacement.

We provide high-quality data, analysis and expertise on internal displacement to inform policy and operational decisions that can improve the lives of internally displaced people (IDPs) worldwide and reduce the risk of future displacement.
fields.Link to Data Products Overview:
GIDD: <https://www.internal-displacement.org/database/displacement-data/>
IDU: <https://www.internal-displacement.org/internal-displacement-updates/>
Good Practices Repository: [https://www.internal displacement.org/good-practices/](https://www.internal-displacement.org/good-practices/)
Severity Assessments: <https://www.internal-displacement.org/displacement-severity-assessments/>
<https://www.internal-displacement.org/displacement-risk/>
GRID: <https://www.internal-displacement.org/global-report/>

fields.Org Description: ETH Zurich is founded on core Swiss values such as freedom, individual responsibility, entrepreneurial spirit, and open-mindedness. Established in 1855 as a center for innovation and knowledge, the university is home to the Weather and Climate Risks (WCR) Group. The WCR Group develops the CLIMADA platform, an open-source tool for probabilistic climate risk assessment and adaptation planning, and leads projects like scClim, which integrates weather predictions and climate simulations to assess hail impacts, and SPARCCLE, which models climate extremes and their effects on global ecosystems.

fields.Org Full Name: World Bank-UNHCR Joint Data Center on Forced Displacement

fields.Org Description: Start Network is a network of aid agencies across the world, working together to revolutionise the global humanitarian system.

Latinobarómetro Corporation is a non-profit NGO based in Santiago, Chile, and is solely responsible for the production and publication of the data.
Latinobarómetro Corporation researches the development of democracy and economies as well as societies, using indicators of opinion, attitudes, behaviour and values. Its results are used by social and political actors, international organizations, governments and the media.
The executive director of the study is Marta Lagos.

Collaboration is Data2X’s guiding principle and signature way of working. This reflects our core strength: our convening power based on the trust we have earned from government, private sector, civil society, and academic partners. In the coming years, Data2X will play an even more active facilitator role, mobilizing stakeholders around a cooperative global approach to fill gender data gaps.

fields.Org Full Name: IPC: Integrated Food Security Phase Classification
fields.Org Description: The IPC global partnership is comprised of 19 organizations and inter-governmental institutions including Action Against Hunger (AAH), CARE International, Comité Permanent Inter-Etats de Lutte Contre la Sécheresse au Sahel (Permanent Interstate Committee for Drought Control in the Sahel) (CILSS), Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO), Famine Early Warning Systems Network (FEWS NET), the Global Food Security Cluster, the Global Nutrition Cluster, Intergovernmental Authority on Development (IGAD), Joint Research Centre (JRC) of the European Commission, Oxford Committee for Famine Relief (Oxfam), Southern African Development Community (SADC), Save the Children, Sistema de la Integración Centroamericana (Central American Integration System) (SICA), World Food Programme (WFP), United Nations Children’s Fund (UNICEF), the World Bank, the Wolrd Health Organization (WHO), UNDP and IFPRI.

The Pacific Community (SPC) is the principal scientific and technical organisation in the Pacific region, proudly supporting development since 1947. We are an international development organisation owned and governed by our 27 country and territory members. The Pacific Community supports sustainable development by applying a people-centred approach to science, research and technology across all of the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). We serve our members by interweaving and harnessing the nexus of climate, ocean, land, culture, rights and good governance; through trusted partnerships; investing in Pacific people; and understanding Pacific contexts.

The United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP) is the leading global authority on the environment. UNEP’s mission is to inspire, inform, and enable nations and peoples to improve their quality of life without compromising that of future generations.

ACAPS, which originally stood for the "Assessment Capacities Project," is an independent, non-governmental organization that provides humanitarian information and analysis to support better-informed decision-making in crisis situations. It offers data and analysis on global humanitarian crises to organizations like the UN, humanitarian responders, and donors, with the goal of improving aid delivery and efficiency. ACAPS provides global analysis, and works with other organizations to improve evidence-based decision-making in humanitarian response.

The University of Minnesota provides extensive data services and projects through various centers, including the Minnesota Research Data Center (MnRDC), which provides researchers secure access to non-public data from the U.S. Census Bureau and other government agencies. Their data services also encompass data infrastructure assessment, record linkage, machine learning, innovative data capture, and data access and preservation. The IPUMS Center for Data Integration is a prominent provider of census and survey data globally, further showcasing the University's commitment to data integration and research.

fields.Org Full Name: UNITAR: UN Institute for Training and Research
fields.Org Description: UNITAR focuses on building capacity in the use of data for evidence-based decision-making, particularly in developing countries. They organize workshops and develop toolkits on governance for data ecosystems, with a special emphasis on supporting the implementation of the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). UNITAR also helps strengthen statistical training at national and local levels, promotes access to statistical learning for data producers, enables the use of new data sources like citizen data, and enhances the effective use of data by policymakers and stakeholders through statistical literacy initiatives.

IOM’s work is guided by a commitment to upholding the dignity, safety, and protection of individuals affected by crises, even in the most challenging response contexts worldwide. All activities are designed to respect the rights and needs of people in vulnerable situations, ensuring that humanitarian assistance is delivered with sensitivity, impartiality, and a focus on safeguarding those at risk. IOM prioritizes ethical standards and best practices to foster environments where affected populations are treated with respect and their well-being is central to every intervention.

fields.Org Full Name: UNESCAP: United Nations Economic and Social Commission for Asia and the Pacific
fields.Org Description: UNESCAP leverages data and statistics to address key development challenges in the Asia-Pacific region, providing member states with results-oriented projects, technical assistance, and capacity building. They work across various areas, including macroeconomic policy, poverty reduction, trade, environment, disaster risk reduction, and social development. UNESCAP promotes the use of data for evidence-based decision-making and fosters regional cooperation on transboundary issues, utilizing rigorous analysis and peer learning to inform policy dialogues and recommendations.
The mission of the Water Point Data Exchange (WPdx) is to unlock the potential of water point data to improve rural water services through evidence-based decision-making.

The Partnership in Statistics for Development in the 21st Century (PARIS21) aims to improve the production, quality, availability, and use of statistics for informed decision making for sustainable development. It was established in 1999 by the United Nations, the European Commission, the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD), the International Monetary Fund, and the World Bank as a response to the need for accurate and reliable data to achieve and track progress toward development goals.

The University of Oxford supports researchers and students with a suite of data services, primarily through the Bodleian Data Service, which offers access to statistics and data for secondary use. Oxford also provides research data management services for storing, publishing, and preserving research data outputs. Their Data Reporting, Architecture and Modelling (DRAM) team within IT Services offers comprehensive support for data management, analysis, and reporting, guided by the University IT Strategic Plan and Data Strategy.

iMMAP Inc. is an international nonprofit organization that provides information management services to humanitarian and development organizations, enabling partners to make informed decisions that ultimately provide high-quality targeted assistance to the world’s most vulnerable populations.
fields.Org Mission:
iMMAP Inc.'s mission is to harness the power of information to facilitate evidence-based decisions to improve people’s lives.

iMMAP Inc. turns data into information and creates knowledge for decision-makers operating in development contexts, situations of violence, post-disaster, and conflict recovery.

fields.Org Description: The World Health Organization (WHO) aims to achieve the highest attainable standard of health for all people worldwide, defining health as a state of complete physical, mental, and social well-being, not merely the absence of disease or infirmity. Its primary functions include promoting the control of epidemic and endemic diseases, enhancing education and training in public health and medical treatment, and establishing international standards for biological products. The WHO works globally to improve health outcomes and foster cooperation among nations in addressing health challenges.

fields.Org Full Name: RCCC: Red Cross Red Crescent Climate Centre
fields.Org Description: The Climate Centre focuses primarily on providing guidance and tools to National Societies and their partners, and fostering the exchange of experience, training and technical back-up for Red Cross Red Crescent volunteers, delegates and managers specializing in the management of disaster risk and health.
fields.Org IATI Name: Red Cross Red Crescent Climate Centre

fields.Org Full Name: ECMWF: European Centre for Medium-Range Weather Forecasts
fields.Org Description: The European Centre for Medium-Range Weather Forecasts (ECMWF) is both a research institute and a 24/7 operational service, providing global numerical weather predictions and related data to its Member and Co-operating States, as well as the wider community. ECMWF operates a world-class supercomputer facility dedicated to weather forecasting and maintains one of the largest meteorological data archives in the world. Its strategic activities also include delivering advanced training and supporting the World Meteorological Organization (WMO) in the implementation of its programmes.

fields.Org Full Name: DPO: United Nations Department of Peace Operations
fields.Org Description: The UN Department of Peace Operations (DPO) utilizes data to enhance the effectiveness of peace operations and inform decision-making in conflict and post-conflict settings. They manage the UN Peace and Security Data Hub, a public library of datasets on peace and security, providing centralized access to up-to-date information. The Hub empowers a wide range of users, including UN staff, member states, academia, and the public, with data on peacekeeping mandates, quick impact projects, and other related initiatives. DPO also engages in data-related projects such as predictive modeling with peacekeeping demographic data and quantifying the implementation of the Women, Peace and Security agenda through text analysis.

INFORM is a collaboration of the Inter-Agency Standing Committee Reference Group on Risk, Early Warning and Preparedness and the European Commission. INFORM is developing a suite of quantitative, analytical products to support decision-making on humanitarian crises and disasters.
fields.Org Mission: These help make decisions at different stages of the disaster management cycle, specifically climate adaptation and disaster prevention, preparedness and response. INFORM develops methodologies and tools for use at the global level and also supports their application at subnational level.

fields.Org Description: As an international organization, HERA is dedicated to supporting other humanitarian and development organizations in the implementation of their projects and operational strategies. This includes crafting strategic frameworks, establishing security policies, risk assessment, donor mapping, exploratory missions, and evaluation missions. HERA assists organizations in understanding the evolving landscape of the humanitarian system, particularly regarding epidemic control through epidemiological data collection and climate change adaptation by aiding organizations in measuring their carbon footprint and developing strategies to reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

Insecurity Insight examines threats facing people living and working in dangerous environments. Our innovative data collection and analysis methods generate insights relevant for aid workers, aid agencies and those concerned with the protection of health workers, educators, IDPs and refugees. Our aim is to empower those who deliver vital services and to give voices to those affected by insecurity

fields.Org Full Name: LSE: London School of Economics and Political Science
fields.Org Description: The London School of Economics and Political Science concentrates on the study of societies, markets, and governance, producing research in economics, politics, sociology, and international relations, and shaping policy through empirical analysis, comparative institutional study, and global-facing intellectual networks.
